note.title: Common Threat Actors
note.content:
## Threat Actors
An individual or entity responsible for incidents impacting security and data protection.

### Nation-state
- Government-sponsored attackers performing espionage, sabotage, or cyber warfare.
- Use advanced tools, zero-day exploits, custom malware.
- May conduct false flag attacks.
- Often called APTs (Advanced Persistent Threats).

### Unskilled Attacker
- Individuals with limited technical expertise.
- Use pre-made scripts or tools (e.g., LOIC for DDoS attacks).

### Hacktivist
- Driven by political, social, or environmental ideologies.
- Activities: website defacement, DDoS, doxing, data leaks.
- Notable groups: Anonymous, LulzSec.

### Insider Threat
- Security risks originating from within the organization.
- Examples: data theft, sabotage, misuse of privileges.

### Organized Crime
- Structured groups targeting financial gain.
- Techniques: ransomware, identity theft, credit card fraud.
- Often use cryptocurrencies, dark web, or cellular collection devices.
- Examples: FIN7, Carbanak.

### Shadow IT
- Unapproved IT systems, devices, software, and services.
- Examples: personal devices for work, unapproved apps, cloud services, plugins/extensions.

An individual or entity responsible for incidents impacting security and data protection.

Nation-state


    • Government-sponsored attackers performing espionage, sabotage, or cyber warfare.

    • Use advanced tools, zero-day exploits, custom malware.

    • May conduct false flag attacks.

    • Often called APTs (Advanced Persistent Threats).


    Unskilled Attacker


    • Individuals with limited technical expertise.

    • Use pre-made scripts or tools (e.g., LOIC for DDoS attacks).


    Hacktivist

    • Activities: website defacement, DDoS, doxing, data leaks.

    • Notable groups: Anonymous, LulzSec.


    Insider Threat


    • Security risks originating from within the organization.

    • Examples: data theft, sabotage, misuse of privileges.


    Organized Crime


    • Structured groups targeting financial gain.

    • Examples: personal devices for work, unapproved apps, cloud services, plugins/extensions.
